context: The cells with abnormal shape were also found in treated E. gracilis SMZ but much less so in Z with no significance between the treatment and control group (data not shown). The examination and counting of the cells containing lipofuscin suggested that there were one or two of such granules in the cells at lower concentrations of treatment and increased in both numbers and more cells at higher concentrations with deeper brown color appearance (Fig. 3-2).Chlorophyll content decreased by individual and mixed BTEX As presented in Fig. 4 , chlorophyll a of E. gracilis was more sensitive to BTEX while chlorophyll b decreased only at higher concentrations of BTEX. Total chlorophyll content was inhibited by single and mixed BTEX in a dose–response relationship (Figs. 5 and 6 ). The order of response of individual BTEX compounds in terms of EC50 of chlorophyll inhibition was p-xylene> o-xylene>ethylbenzene> m-xylene>toluene>benzene. Based on the individual BTEX dose–response relationship, we constructed a predictive curve for mixed BTEX with equal molar mixture (BTEX-1) using the concentration addition model. The predictive effects proved to be in good agreement with the observed curve by falling within the 95% confident interval of the observed effects as shown in Fig. 6A. The predictive effects were confirmed with the other BTEX mixture, BTEX-2, which represented a typical composition of BTEX in petrol, also showed good agreement with the predictive curve (Fig. 6B).

llm_generation.summary: In this context, ethylbenzene and 4-xylene are both components of the BTEX group, which refers to a mixture of benzene, toluene, ethylbenzene, and xylenes. The study examines their effects on chlorophyll content in E. gracilis, indicating that both compounds contribute to chlorophyll inhibition in a dose-dependent manner. The order of response shows that 4-xylene has a greater effect on chlorophyll inhibition than ethylbenzene, suggesting a comparative analysis of their toxicity within the same experimental framework.
llm_generation.reason: The score of 4 reflects a significant connection between ethylbenzene and 4-xylene, as both are analyzed for their effects on chlorophyll content in the same study. The context provides quantitative data on their relative toxicity, indicating a clear relationship in terms of their impact on biological systems.
